intro: Pisonia horneae, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are ovate and have a rough texture, while its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous seeds. Pisonia horneae is also known for its fragrant blooms, which attract pollinators such as bees and birds.
